definition: variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain
Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia

sentences.english: Mix that fantasy dreamscape sketch with the steampunk idea.
sentences.chinese: 把那个神奇的梦境图和蒸气朋克揉在一起。

sentences.english: Wooden computer case inspired by the Steampunk movement.
sentences.chinese: 由蒸汽朋克运动所启发的木质电脑机箱。

sentences.english: The second single, "A-Punk", was released in early 2008.
sentences.chinese: 第二单，一个朋克，是2008年初发布。

sentences.english: Rock, and then soul, and then punk album covers.
sentences.chinese: 摇滚乐，还有骚灵乐，然后是朋克专辑的封面。

sentences.english: A punky band is prodding uproar.
sentences.chinese: 一个朋克乐队是怂恿一片哗然。

sentences.english: Today we want to make a present to steampunk lovers.
sentences.chinese: 今天，我们要为蒸汽朋克爱好者们准备一份礼物。

sentences.english: Fanzui Xiangfa is a hardcore-punk band from Beijing, China.
sentences.chinese: “犯罪想法”，硬核朋克乐队，来自北京。

sentences.english: In any event, there are few things less “punk” than a rock opera.
sentences.chinese: 无论如何，没有比摇滚歌剧更具有朋克精神的音乐了。

sentences.english: Why did the punk rocker cross the road?
sentences.chinese: 为什么这个朋克横穿马路？

sentences.english: The punk rock musician is humming again over her newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 这时那个朋克音乐家再次喧闹了起来。

sentences.english: Data networks are more than just a part of cyberpunk's subject matter.
sentences.chinese: 数据网络不仅仅是赛博朋克主题的一部分。

sentences.english: Many of POSTMODERNISM's allegedly principal qualities fit cyberpunk like a glove.
sentences.chinese: 据说许多后现代主义的主要特征完全和赛博朋克雷同。

sentences.english: We were the only punks there.
sentences.chinese: 我们是那里唯一的朋克摇滚乐迷。

sentences.english: Punk purists are perhaps the most loathsome gnats in all of creation.
sentences.chinese: 纯朋克们也许是这个世界上所有物种中最让人讨厌的。

definition: disco dancing/to dance at a disco
Chinese subculture of young urban migrants, usually of low education, with exaggerated hairstyles, heavy make-up, flamboyant costumes, piercings etc (loanword from "smart")
young person who adopts an artistic or intellectual style/abbr. for 文藝青年|文艺青年
